post_text:
Attached you will find Claymont City's reopening plan. Our district's task force planning team has been working since the beginning of June to formulate our plan. Last week, Gov. DeWine came out with guidance for schools to finalize their reopening plans. Along with state guidance, our district has used survey results to help formulate our plan. It has been a stressful time for our task force as our first priority is educating students and now trying to ensure safety of everyone. Thank you to our task force members!

Today our county is functioning at a Level 2, which for us educationally would mean we would be in face to face education. 4 days a week of face to face with Fridays as a remote learning day. If/when our county moves to Level 3, we would shift our educational plans to an A/B grouping. Each group would come to school for 2 days and the other 3 would be in remote learning options. Level 4 would mean all students would be educated remotely. Staff will be reporting on days of face to face and remote learning days.

The official start date of school is Sept. 8th.

SWARM, Sustainable Wildlife Area Restoration Movement, will be holding a fundraiser at Chipotle in New Philadelphia on Sunday, February 23rd from 4:00 to 8:00pm. Proceeds will go toward funding the creation of a pollinator garden and wildlife habitats at CHS.

Everyone that goes to Chipotle during the time of the event will have to specifically mention the SWARM event for their purchase to count toward our fundraiser, but they do not have to present the physical flyer to the cashier.

A pollinator garden is a garden that is planted predominantly with flowers that provide nectar or pollen for a wide range of pollinating insects like butterflies. The wildlife habitats will provide a nesting area for birds like bluebirds and ruby-throated hummingbirds.

All plants in these locations will be native to Ohio to help highlight Ohio's natural beauty and fight the spread of invasive species. These locations will be used for educational purposes in several classes over the coming years.

Remember you just have to mention the SWARM event for your purchase to count toward our fundraiser,

Carrie Woods Kunkle is feeling festive with Naomi Hallman.
December 10, 2019 at 7:36 PM ·

Claymont High School's visual arts department has been pretty busy this holiday season!

Art III kicked it off by painting elf portraits to hang at the North Pole for Dennison's Polar Express. Riders from a multi-state area have enjoyed the art when riding the train.

Art Club then got to work today on a festive Charlie Brown Christmas scene at the Uhrichsville McDonald's.

We are genuinely happy to have our artistry on display in both Uhrichsville and at the North Pole this holiday season!

post_text: Claymont 5th grade students have been studying Economics in Social Studies. They have learned about the buying and selling of goods and products. As part of this, the students brought in the items needed to bake things like cookies, bread, brownies etc. They mixed and baked items on December 9th, 10th and 11th. The students will then host a bake sale on December 12th and 13th during lunch. Profits will be used to purchase Christmas gifts for a Claymont City School District family.
